New Title: Rafael Nadal withdraws from Indian Wells due to injury
News: The 36-year-old Spaniard, who was a runner-up last year in Indian Wells, has not competed since his Australian Open title defense in January ended in a second-round defeat.

New Title: David Alaba abused, Croatia coach critical following FIFA awards
News: “The Austrian national team vote for this award as a team, not me alone,” Alaba wrote on his social media accounts. “Everyone in the team council is able to vote and that's how it's decided.

New Title: Chelsea defender Thiago Silva suffers knee ligament damage
News: The Brazil international picked up the injury in the first half of their 2-0 defeat at London rivals Tottenham Hotspur in the league on Sunday.

New Title: French federation head Noel Le Graet quits amid harassment allegations
News: Earlier this month, a French sports ministry audit concluded Le Graet was no longer fit to administer and represent the sport in France and "highlighted the inappropriate behaviour of Mr Le Graet towards women".

New Title: Antonio Conte set to return after Spurs’ FA Cup trip to Sheffield United: Cristian Stellini
News: Conte is recovering after undergoing a gall bladder surgery last month but Spurs have done well in his absence with Stellini on the touchline, moving up to fourth in the Premier League.

New Title: Get back to work – Man United not resting on laurels, says Erik Ten Hag
News: The Old Trafford side beat Newcastle United in the League Cup final on Sunday to lift a major trophy for the first time since the 2017 Europa League.

New Title: French officials probe rape accusation against PSG’s Achraf Hakimi
News: The official would not provide details about the accusation or comment on media reports about what allegedly happened. The official was not authorized to be publicly named speaking about an ongoing investigation.

New Title: A couple of holes in my shoes with few legs sticking in, says Neil Wagner about team huddle after New Zealand beat England by 1 run
News: Left-arm fast bowler took four crucial wickets - Ollie Pope, Joe Root, Ben Stokes, and last man James Anderson just when the second Test seemed to be slipping away from New Zealand's grasp

New Title: Lionel Messi and Alexia Putellas voted best players at FIFA awards
News: After steering Argentina to World Cup glory in an epic final against Mbappé’s France last year in Qatar, Messi won the best player vote against Mbappé and Karim Benzema to secure the FIFA prize for the seventh time in 14 years.

New Title: IND vs AUS: Steve Smith says Australia batsmen will ditch ‘risky tempo’ in third Test
News: Australia's hopes of reclaiming the Border-Gavaskar Trophy have been extinguished following back-to-back defeats in Nagpur and New Delhi, with the touring batsmen struggling to score on spin-friendly wickets.

New Title: Irani Cup: Chance for Mayank to remain relevant
News: Though the Irani Cup has lost much of its significance in the last 15 years as most national players are always on the move, the tournament, at an individual level, is important for Agarwal, especially in the backdrop of KL Rahul's dipping form.

New Title: FIFA Awards 2023 Highlights: Lionel Messi wins FIFA Best Men’s Player award, Alexia Putellas gets Best Women’s Player
News: FIFA Best Awards 2023 Highlights: Argentina coach Lionel Scaloni was voted FIFA men's coach of the year after leading his team to the World Cup title in December. The women’s coach award went to Sarina Wiegman, who led the England to the title at the Women's European Championship.

New Title: Richa Ghosh only Indian in ICC’s ‘Most Valuable Team’ of Women’s T20 World Cup
News: Four players from Australia, who lifted the trophy for a record-extending sixth time, figure in the XI.

New Title: Brathwaite braced for South Africa challenge in first test
News: West Indies have lost 12 of their previous 15 tests in South Africa and won just one, though this is the first time they have toured the country in the longest format since 2015.

New Title: Paul Pogba is back in Juve squad, Massimiliano Allegri says
News: The France international had an operation on a damaged meniscus in September and also missed the World Cup in Qatar with the national team.

New Title: Barcelona’s Lewandowski set to miss Real Madrid tie with injury
News: Lewandowski has been Barcelona's top scorer this season with 25 goals in all competitions.

New Title: AIFF’s top officials discuss Indian football with counterparts from Belgium
News: Chaubey and Prabhakaran were greeted by Royal Belgian Football Association president Paul Van den Bulck, CEO Peter Bossaert, operations director, football, Jelle Schelstraete, and advisor Hedeli Sassi at the football body's headquarters.
